translation.en: [reporter] People once called New York "Fun City."
Now the police and firemen's unions in New York are calling it "Fear City."
translation.ko: 이제 경찰과 소방관 노조는 뉴욕을 '공포의 도시'라 부릅니다

translation.en: [man 4] There was a dispute over here, and he gets shot in the head.
translation.ko: 다툼이 있었는데 남자가 머리에 총을 맞았어요

translation.en: -[radio squawks] -[indistinct chatter]
translation.ko: "1970년대 뉴욕은" "마약과 폭력, 살인으로 몸살을 앓는 무법 도시였다"

translation.en: -[man 5] ...take that cocksucker out. -[siren droning]
translation.ko: "마약과 폭력, 살인으로 몸살을 앓는 무법 도시였다"

translation.en: [man 6] This is a story about New York.
[woman] There's been a lot of muggings,
killings.
[man 7] Seven people have been murdered, their throats cut with a foot-long knife.
[man 6] It's a story about horrible acts of violence.
It seems organized crime may have turned an abandoned railroad tunnel
translation.ko: 폐철도 터널이 조직범죄로 인해 60명이나 되는 인명의

translation.en: into a graveyard for as many as 60 people.
[man 8] Twenty-seven people have been eliminated.
[man 6] And then it's a story about greed for money and power and dominance.
translation.ko: 그리고 돈에 대한 탐욕, 권력과 지배력에 대한 이야기죠

translation.en: [man 8] Federal officials say the Mob's income
translation.ko: 연방 당국에 따르면 마피아의 연간 수입은 600억에서 1천억 달러에 달합니다

translation.en: could total 60 to 100 billion dollars a year.
[man 9] Ninety-seven-04.
[man 6] New York was held in the grip of the Mafia.
...as I've tried to tell the president, the vice president, to Congress,
translation.ko: 나는 현 상황을 대통령과 부통령, 의회에

translation.en: what's going on here, they're not listening. This is a war.
translation.ko: 얘기하려 노력해왔는데 아무도 듣지 않아요 이건 전쟁입니다

translation.en: [man 10] The director of the FBI said, "What are we going to do about this?"
translation.ko: FBI 국장이 말했어요 '우리가 뭘 해야 막을 수 있지?'

translation.en: [man 11] This was billed as the biggest organized crime investigation ever.
translation.ko: 이건 사상 최대의 조직범죄 수사로 알려져 있어요

translation.en: [man 12] We were gonna bug the Mafia.
-[man 13] Is Jimmy there? -[man 14] He left about five minutes ago.
[man 12] We were gonna hear them on the tapes, with our very own ears.
translation.ko: 테이프에서 흘러나오는 대화를 귀로 직접 들으려고 했어요

translation.en: ♪ People all around me And they're all in fear ♪
[man] In the '70s, the city of New York was owned by the Mob.
I had seen what Italian organized crime
had done in the neighborhood I grew up in in Brooklyn.
A few summers, I worked for my uncle, Jimmy Schiavone, in a butcher shop.
translation.ko: 저는 여름에 우리 삼촌인 "커티스 슬리와" 지미 스카본의 정육점에서 일했어요

translation.en: My uncle, he owed money to the Mob.
The poor guy worked six days a week to pay it back.
Meantime, I'd see these wiseguys come in from the Bonanno crime family...
translation.ko: 보난노 범죄 패밀리의 조직원들이 찾아오곤 했어요

translation.en: bulls.
And my... my uncle was in the back.
And he would be schvitzing.
He would be sweating, because they'd be threatening him.
translation.ko: 땀을 뻘뻘 흘리고 있더군요 놈들이 협박했거든요

translation.en: They'd threaten his son, Joey, Jr.
They'd threaten my aunt, Aunt Lucy.
And actually they'd look at me and say, "Who's the kid, right?"
translation.ko: 저를 쳐다보더니 저 꼬마는 누구냐고 물어요

translation.en: And he'd say, "No, no he's just the delivery boy."
But, man, that was frightening days.
You knew when you borrowed money from them.
They-- If you didn't pay on time,
they'd bend your leg and stuff it in your pocket.
translation.ko: 다리깽이를 접어서 주머니에 쑤셔 넣는다는 걸요

translation.en: [man] My boxing trainer, my baseball coach,
my barber were all involved with the Mob.
And I started getting an education,
really understanding the street by the time I'm 14, 15.
By the time I'm the time I'm 17, 18,
I'm already collecting money.
And I'm told when to talk, when not to talk,
translation.ko: "조니 에일라이트" 입을 언제 열고, 닫을지 언제 누굴 해쳐야 할지 배웠죠

translation.en: or when to just hurt somebody.
translation.ko: 입을 언제 열고, 닫을지 언제 누굴 해쳐야 할지 배웠죠

translation.en: [Alite] You wanna motivate 'em.
"Better have that money this fucking week.
If you don't have that money, I'm gonna come see you in a different way.
translation.ko: '돈 준비 안 하면 이렇게 말로 끝나지 않아'

translation.en: Have that fucking money." Now, when a guy comes to see me
and he insults me with $1,000, yeah, I hurt him.
After I hurt him, I tell him to go get me the rest of my fucking money.
translation.ko: 두들겨 팬 다음 나머지 돈도 가져오라고 말해요

translation.en: Now there's no patience.
He doesn't have the money a week before then, I baseball bat him.
translation.ko: 일주일 안에 돈 안 가져오면 방망이를 휘둘러주죠

translation.en: [man 2] I liked lending money out to people. It was good business.
If somebody couldn't pay,
then the idea is we become their partner.
I acquired a Chevrolet agency that way.
Then I started making a lot of money
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 많은 돈을 벌고 이득을 챙기기 시작했죠

translation.en: and started to use that life to benefit me.
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 많은 돈을 벌고 이득을 챙기기 시작했죠 "마이클 프란체세"

translation.en: [man 3] The gasoline scheme was the biggest thing that certainly I ever had.
translation.ko: 저한테는 휘발유 사업이 가장 큰 건이었어요

translation.en: There was a guy that had a small gas operation out in Long Island.
translation.ko: 롱아일랜드에서 작은 가스 사업을 했던 사람이

translation.en: He comes to me, and he says, "Mike, I have a germ of an idea,
translation.ko: 저를 찾아와 말하길 '마이크, 좋은 아이디어가 있는데'

translation.en: where we might be able to defraud the government out of tax on a gallon of gasoline."
translation.ko: '휘발유 1갤런당 세금을 빼돌려서 정부를 속일 수 있을 거 같아'

translation.en: So he got my attention. I didn't like the government.
Puts the box on the table. Opens it up.
translation.ko: 상자 하나를 탁자 위에 올려놓고 열더니

translation.en: He said, "This is the first week's take in the gas business: $320,000."
translation.ko: '이건 휘발유 사업으로 첫 주에 번 돈인데' '32만 달러야'

translation.en: From that point on,
I grew that operation to between eight and ten million dollars a week.
translation.ko: 그 사업을 키워서 일주일에 8백만에서 1천만 달러가 됐어요

translation.en: We were selling gas to branded, unbranded stations, everybody,
translation.ko: 우리 휘발유는 사방으로 팔려나갔어요 세금 내는 사람들보다 싸게 팔고 있었으니까요

translation.en: 'cause we were undercutting everybody. We weren't paying the tax.
translation.ko: 세금 내는 사람들보다 싸게 팔고 있었으니까요

translation.en: The FBI couldn't figure it out.
I'll never forget one day:
I was at my office at my automobile dealership.
translation.ko: 저는 제 자동차 대리점 사무실에 있었는데

translation.en: Two FBI agents come in.
They said, "Look, we know you got something going on with this gas.
translation.ko: 당신이 휘발유 사업에 숨기는 게 있는 걸 아는데

translation.en: Just tell us how you're doing it.
You tell us how you're doing it. We'll give you a pass."
I said, "I dunno what you're talking about.
You wanna buy a car? I'll give you a break.
I like you guys. Don't worry about it."
But that's how frustrated they were with us.
translation.ko: 우리 때문에 그 정도로 답답했던 거죠

translation.en: They knew we were doing it, but they could never figure it out.
translation.ko: 딴짓 하는 건 알아도 단서를 못 찾았어요

translation.en: It was the golden era of the Mob.
The FBI couldn't keep up with us. There was no way.
translation.ko: FBI는 우릴 감당 못 했어요 방법이 없었으니까요

translation.en: [man] Our relationship with the Mafia... it was a cat and mouse game.
translation.ko: 마피아와 우리의 관계는 고양이와 쥐 게임 같았어요

translation.en: A very serious game, to be sure.
I can't tell you how many times a wiseguy would say to me,
translation.ko: 조직원들은 늘 이렇게 말해요 "린 데베키오 특별 수사관, FBI"

translation.en: "You do what you gotta do. I do what I gotta do."
translation.ko: '당신은 당신 일을 난 내 일을 해요'

translation.en: I used to tell them, "Hey, you do your job. We'll do ours.
translation.ko: 이렇게 말해주죠 '당신은 당신 일을 우린 우리 일을 해요'

translation.en: You catch us the right way, no complaints."
Their job is to lock you up. Our job is to get away with it.
translation.ko: 그들은 우릴 잡는 게 일이고 우린 빠져나가는 게 일이에요

translation.en: You see them in a van,
you smile and you wave, because you're being cocky with them.
translation.ko: 웃으며 손을 흔들어요 그만큼 우습게 보는 거죠

translation.en: They'd either walk away or tell me fuck off.
If you didn't get told that in Brooklyn, you'd done something wrong.
translation.ko: 브루클린에서 그런 말 못 들었다면 일을 제대로 안 한 거죠

translation.en: [man] There was organized crime investigations being conducted
translation.ko: 조직범죄 수사는 FBI의 각기 다른 사무실 3곳에서

translation.en: in three separate FBI offices,
but each of them had their own idea about how to approach the problem.
translation.ko: 하지만 사건에 접근하는 방식은 제각기 달랐죠

translation.en: So, there was organized crime, but very unorganized investigations.
translation.ko: 조직범죄 수사를 "짐 코슬러 FBI 팀장" 비조직적으로 한 겁니다

translation.en: We had no strategy. We had no plan.
[DeVecchio] When we would come across somebody we didn't know,
the only thing we could do was take a photograph of them.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 건 사진 찍는 거뿐이었어요

translation.en: Then we could go out to our informants and say, "Do you know this guy?"
translation.ko: 그 사진을 정보원한테 보여주고 아는 자인지 묻는 거죠

translation.en: They'd say, "Yeah, I know that guy." "What's he do?
What's his criminal activity? Who's he connected with?"
translation.ko: 어떤 범죄를 저질렀고 누구와 연결돼 있는지 묻고

translation.en: And then we'd put them on a board.
We had a very, very good idea of who was who
translation.ko: 우린 누가 누군지 잘 알고 마피아가 뉴욕에 어떻게 조직됐는지 잘 파악하고 있었어요

translation.en: and how the Mafia was structured in New York.
translation.ko: 마피아가 뉴욕에 어떻게 조직됐는지 잘 파악하고 있었어요

translation.en: The five Italian organized crime families were
Gambino, Genovese, Lucchese, Colombo, and Bonanno.
translation.ko: 감비노, 제노베세, 루케세 콜롬보, 보난노로 나뉘죠

translation.en: The families were very structured.
It started at the top with the boss,
then you had the underboss, who was really the second in command,
translation.ko: 그 밑에 두 번째 실세인 부두목이 있고

translation.en: and then you had your caporegimes, captains,
and then you had the soldiers under them.
The way the families were structured gave us a very powerful position.
translation.ko: 이런 패밀리의 구조는 우리를 강력한 위치에 서게 했어요

translation.en: The biggest problem was that you could never get to an underboss
or the boss himself.
They were too well-insulated from whatever criminal activity was done.
translation.ko: 어떤 범죄가 벌어져도 확실하게 단절돼 있어서 "프랭키 데스텔라노 조 N. 갈로"

translation.en: They had no connection with it whatsoever.
The lower-level guys were out there committing the criminal acts
and kicking the money up to the higher-ups.
The average wiseguy, we knew what he was doing.
We put him in jail for a year,
but it didn't solve the problem.
Whatever their money making scheme was went right on, virtually without interruption,
translation.ko: 그들이 하던 돈벌이는 전혀 지장 없이 계속됐어요

translation.en: 'cause there's a lot of guys waiting in the wings to take his place.
[Sliwa] You know how I would spot the wiseguys?
-Well, particularly in the disco era... -Mm-hmm.
...they had the polyester waffle-weave bell bottoms.
translation.ko: 그들은 폴리 와플 원단으로 된 나팔바지를 입었어요 "카를로 바카레차"

translation.en: They had the open neck, you know? They had to have the hair.
Then they'd have their toilette water on, you know, like that Old Spice, Hai Karate.
translation.ko: 게다가 저렴한 화장수를 썼어요 올드 스파이스나 하이 가라테 같은 거요

translation.en: -Lilac water. -Ah.
translation.ko: 올드 스파이스나 하이 가라테 같은 거요

translation.en: Man, you light a match, you'd all be blown to kingdom come.
[Alite] In the '70s, when we started moving heroin and cocaine, it was huge.
translation.ko: 70년대에 헤로인과 코카인을 팔기 시작했는데 큰 돈벌이였어요

translation.en: We were making a million a month.
We partied constantly.
All the gangsters used.
They'll tell you they never did, but they did.
translation.ko: 다들 안 한다고 했지만, 다 했고

translation.en: Say nobody cheated on their wives, but everybody cheated on their wives.
translation.ko: 바람 안 피운다고 하면서 다들 피웠어요

translation.en: Nobody drank champagne. We drank champagne day and night.
[Sliwa] The wiseguys were collecting the moola-shmoola.
translation.ko: 조직원들이 원하는 건 뭐든 손에 넣는 사이에

translation.en: In the mean time, the city of New York was total anarchy.
The Bronx was burning like every night.
Buildings were being either torched by the landlord for the insurance
translation.ko: 보험금을 노린 임대인이 건물에 불을 지르거나

translation.en: or torched by gangs.
[man] There is a war in progress on the streets of New York
to see who's gonna control portions of the illegal drug market.
translation.ko: 누가 장악할 것인지를 놓고 전쟁이 벌어지고 있습니다

translation.en: [DeVecchio] New York was lawless.
[man] One hundred eighty-seven banks were robbed in this town this month,
translation.ko: 이 도시에는 이번 달에 187건의 은행강도 사건이 벌어졌지만

translation.en: and there's still another day left.
[DeVecchio] Bank robberies, hijackings, drugs, murder, extortion,
loan sharking, gambling, you name it.
Organized crime controlled virtually everything you can think of.
No matter how much manpower we put out there,
the Mafia ran virtually unfettered in New York.
[reporter] The Guardian Angels
is a group of youths who have taken it upon themselves to fight subway crime.
translation.ko: 지하철 범죄에 대항하여 자체 결성된 청년 조직입니다

translation.en: [Sliwa] We had to take the law into our own hands.
As Guardian Angels, trying to maintain law and order...
translation.ko: 가디언 에인절스로서 법과 질서 유지를 위해 노력하죠

translation.en: The cops didn't like it, but we said, "Tough noogies, too bad,
translation.ko: 반기지 않는 경찰에겐 '멋대로 하시지' "커티스 슬리와 가디언 에인절스 설립자"

translation.en: because you guys turned the city over to organized crime."
[Franzese] Look, I had a jet plane. I had a Lear 25. I had a helicopter at that time.
translation.ko: 그때는 자가용 소형 제트기와 헬리콥터도 있었어요

translation.en: I had a house in Florida, a house in New York.
I built a 7,000-square-foot house with a racquetball court.
[Alite] We were untouchable.
Who's gonna stop us?
You felt like you had the power to do anything you want.
translation.ko: 원하는 건 뭐든 할 수 있는 힘을 가진 거 같았죠

translation.en: I didn't have any power to do anything.
translation.ko: 난 어떤 것도 할 힘이 없었어요

translation.en: We were lucky if we put one or two guys in jail every year.
translation.ko: 매년 한두 명을 감옥으로 보내면 운이 좋은 거였죠

translation.en: [Alite] I didn't feel New York was mine for the taking.
I thought we already took it.
[Kossler] New York was held in the grip of the Mafia.
The government was not controlling much of anything.
That was the worst part about it. People didn't believe that law enforcement
translation.ko: 그게 가장 큰 문제였죠 시민들은 사법당국이 마피아에

translation.en: could do anything about the Mafia.
translation.ko: 어떤 조치를 취할 거라 믿지 않았고

translation.en: It was gonna be here forever.
[Kossler] We had a meeting in Washington, D.C., the Department of Justice.
translation.ko: 우린 워싱턴에서 열린 법무부 회의에 참석했어요

translation.en: The director of the FBI said, "What are we going to do about this?"
translation.ko: FBI 국장이 말했죠 '우리가 뭘 해야 막을 수 있지?'

translation.en: [man] At the time, the FBI was totally unsuccessful.
But we already had the perfect tools to bring down the Mafia.
translation.ko: 하지만 이미 우리에겐 마피아를 무너뜨릴 완벽한 도구가 있었죠

translation.en: The Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act...
translation.ko: 흔히 리코법이라 불리는 부패 및 조직범죄 처벌법은

translation.en: commonly referred to as RICO,
was a law that I wrote in 1970 to dismantle the Mafia, bosses and all.
translation.ko: 마피아 보스들과 조직들을 해체하려 작성한 법률입니다

translation.en: The FBI had this law for ten years and didn't know how to use it.
translation.ko: FBI는 10년 동안 이 법을 가지고도 사용할 방법을 몰랐어요

translation.en: So I figured maybe what we could do is have a training course
translation.ko: 교육 과정이 필요하겠다 싶었죠 "로버트 블래이키 교수 코넬 로스쿨, 1973-1980"

translation.en: at Cornell, right here.
[Kossler] March of '79, the boss wanted us to go
to a seminar at Cornell University Law School
having to do with organized crime problems.
It was a week of spending time away from the family.
I wasn't really seeing what benefit it was to me or to us.
translation.ko: 그 세미나가 우리한테 도움이 될 거 같지 않아서

translation.en: I went kicking and screaming,
but as it turned out, it would change everything.
translation.ko: 결과적으로 그 세미나가 모든 걸 바꿔놨죠

translation.en: [Blakey] Question is, why RICO?
You need to know what we had before RICO.
translation.ko: 리코법이 있기 전에 우리가 뭘 했는지 알아야 해요

translation.en: Before RICO, we could arrest the foot soldiers in the Mafia family
translation.ko: 리코법 시행 전에는 갈취, 살인, 마약 밀매로 마피아 패밀리의 행동대원들을 체포할 수 있었어요

translation.en: for things like extortion, murder, drug-dealing,
translation.ko: 마피아 패밀리의 행동대원들을 체포할 수 있었어요

translation.en: but we had no way of tying...
the foot soldiers to the bosses.
I was telling them, "What you've gotta do is take out the organization.
translation.ko: 제가 강조했던 건 조직을 제거해야 한다는 거였어요

translation.en: And you're not gonna take out the organization
unless you focus on the organization."
By defining these people as bosses and members of this organization,
translation.ko: 이 사람들을 조직의 보스와 조직원들로 규정하면

translation.en: they're now all joined together.
Using RICO, a person can now be convicted
because they ordered somebody to commit a crime.
translation.ko: 명령한 사람도 유죄가 될 수 있는 거예요

translation.en: So you could now prosecute a group of people
who had committed those crimes together.
translation.ko: 사람들의 조직을 기소할 수 있는 거죠

translation.en: That way you can go after the whole organization at one time.
translation.ko: 이렇게 하면 조직 전체를 한꺼번에 추적할 수 있어요

translation.en: You need to be able to show that this crime was related
translation.ko: 여러분은 이 범죄가 처음부터 조직과 연루돼 있었다는 걸

translation.en: to an organization that does crime the whole time.
translation.ko: 여러분은 이 범죄가 처음부터 조직과 연루돼 있었다는 걸 증명할 수 있어야 합니다

translation.en: -The definition of power... -[Kossler] Bob Blakey said,
translation.ko: 권력의 정의는... 밥 블래이키는 마피아 조직원들을 개개인이 아닌

translation.en: "You should prosecute these Mob guys not as individual people,
translation.ko: 밥 블래이키는 마피아 조직원들을 개개인이 아닌

translation.en: but as a group of people committing crimes as a business."
translation.ko: 범죄를 저지르는 집단으로 기소해야 한다고 했어요

translation.en: It was like an epiphany for me... a rush.
Now I could see how I could redirect the agents
translation.ko: 그제야 저는 요원들을 어떻게 재배치해야 할지 알았고

translation.en: and make them understand what we had to do.
translation.ko: 우리가 해야 할 일이 뭔지 이해시킬 수 있었어요

translation.en: Now I knew how we could bring down the entire New York Mafia.
translation.ko: 뉴욕의 마피아 전체를 무너뜨릴 방법을 알게 된 거죠

translation.en: [Kossler] The plan was to develop a RICO case
translation.ko: 각각의 5대 패밀리를 상대로 리코 사건을 전개한다는 방안이었어요

translation.en: against each of the Five Families.
translation.ko: 각각의 5대 패밀리를 상대로 리코 사건을 전개한다는 방안이었어요 "1. 절차 A. 계획 수립 체계"

translation.en: Organized crime requires organized investigation.
We would have five Family squads,
and all the information about that particular Family
would only go that one squad.
[DeVecchio] Kossler brought us into the conference room one day
translation.ko: 어느 날 코슬러가 우리를 회의실로 불러서 이렇게 말했어요

translation.en: and said, "We're not leaving the room until we have a written document
translation.ko: '우린 리코법에 따라 조직범죄 사건들의 수사 방향을'

translation.en: of how we work... organized crime cases under the RICO statute."
translation.ko: '문서로 작성하기 전까지는 이 방을 나가지 않을 거야'

translation.en: We didn't know anything about the RICO law, frankly, because we never used it.
translation.ko: 우린 리코법을 전혀 몰랐어요 그런 걸 적용한 적이 없었거든요

translation.en: All of a sudden, people said, "Wait a minute. I have all these cases
involving all those people down here."
"Close them, because we're only gonna go after these people up here."
[DeVecchio] You're talking about a major operation:
one squad per family, going after the bosses of all Five Families.
translation.ko: 다섯 패밀리의 보스들을 추적하는 대대적인 작전이었어요

translation.en: When he first broached that to me, I...
I had my doubts. How're we gonna do that?
The problem was that no matter how hard you tried,
it was very, very difficult to get a cooperating witness.
translation.ko: 협조적인 증인을 찾는 게 너무 어렵다는 거였어요

translation.en: They were too afraid to talk on the record.
[Franzese] We had a strict code.
It was the main reason why the Mob survived and prospered
for well over a hundred years in this country.
I took the blood oath on Halloween Night, 1975.
translation.ko: 저는 1975년 핼러윈 밤에 피의 선서를 했어요

translation.en: The boss was seated at the head of, like, a horseshoe configuration,
translation.ko: 보스는 편자 형태의 대열 맨 앞에 앉고

translation.en: and all the captains were alongside of that.
I held out my hand. He took a knife, cut my finger.
translation.ko: 제가 손을 내밀자 보스가 칼로 제 손가락을 베었고

translation.en: He took a picture of a saint, put it on my hands, lit a flame...
translation.ko: 성자의 사진을 제 손에 올려놓고 불을 붙이며

translation.en: and he said, "Tonight, Michael Franzese, you are born again into a new life."
translation.ko: '오늘 밤, 마이클 프란체세가 새로운 삶으로 다시 태어난다'

translation.en: He said, "Betray your brothers and you will die and burn in hell
translation.ko: '형제들을 배반하면 네 손 위의 성자처럼 '너도 지옥에서 불타 죽을 것이다'

translation.en: like this saint is burning in your hands."
He said, "Do you accept?"
"Yes, I do."
Guys like myself...
everybody on the street, they knew, you become the witness,
translation.ko: 거리에 있는 누구라도 증인으로 나서는 건

translation.en: you're probably gonna pay for it with your life.
You feared the boss.
You feared breaking the code.
[Kossler] Someone who becomes a member of the Mafia won't testify.
translation.ko: 마피아의 일원이 된 사람은 증언하지 않을 겁니다

translation.en: It was a secret society.
But we had a good solution to a big problem.
translation.ko: 하지만 우리에겐 큰 산을 넘을 방법이 있었죠

translation.en: Without cooperating witnesses, the plan was to start bugging the Mob.
translation.ko: 증인들의 협조를 배제하고 마피아를 도청할 계획이었어요

translation.en: Put bugs in the places where they operated.
translation.ko: 그들이 움직이는 곳에 도청기를 설치하는 겁니다

translation.en: It might be a restaurant he frequents.
translation.ko: "란차의 이탈리안 식당" 자주 가는 식당일 수도 있고

translation.en: It might be a car that he uses. It might be his house.
translation.ko: 타고 다니는 차나 집일 수도 있어요

translation.en: The ultimate goal was to record evidence
that's coming directly from the boss's mouth
as to what criminal activity he was involved in
and who was in it involved with him.
You can use that to bring the whole organization down.
translation.ko: 그걸 이용해서 조직 전체를 무너뜨릴 수 있어요

translation.en: That was gonna take a lot of manpower.
I asked headquarters to send us 50 agents.
The director said, "Give New York whatever it needs."
translation.ko: 국장님은 뉴욕에 필요한 건 다 가져가라고 하더군요

translation.en: [man] We started off on day one.
I had the Gambino family. It was one of the most powerful families.
translation.ko: 저는 가장 강력한 패밀리인 감비노 패밀리를 맡았어요

translation.en: There were close to 21 captains, over three hundred soldiers...
translation.ko: 캡틴 21명, 행동대원 3백 명 이상 "브루스 마우 팀장, 감비노 팀, FBI"

translation.en: thousands of associates.
And the largest target was Paul Castellano, the boss of the family.
translation.ko: 최대의 표적은 패밀리의 보스인 폴 카스텔라노였어요

translation.en: Castellano ran the family like a Fortune 500 business.
They called him the white-collar don because he read The Wall Street Journal.
He was very successful financially.
But the most important thing he understood was,
in order to rule a crime family,
you have to instill fear in your soldiers and captains.
translation.ko: 행동대원과 캡틴들에게 공포감을 줘야 한다는 거였고

translation.en: And he had a bunch of real tough guys around him
who were like hit men for the Mob.
[Alite] Paul Castellano was a boss. We knew he was very wealthy.
translation.ko: 우린 폴 카스텔라노는 보스이며 엄청난 부자라는 것과

translation.en: We knew we was very strong.
He had 20-something guys killed.
So when people say he was a soft, white-collar criminal,
translation.ko: 사람들은 그를 온화한 화이트칼라 악당이라고 불렀는데

translation.en: that's the furthest thing from the truth. I actually looked up to the guy.
translation.ko: 너무 동떨어진 별명이죠 사실 저는 그를 존경했어요

translation.en: This is a guy who's smart enough to kill the way had people killed,
translation.ko: 살인을 저질러도 살인자라 불리지 않을 만큼

translation.en: but yet not be called a killer.
Because he is a killer. It's just not by his own hand.
translation.ko: 그래도 살인자는 맞아요 자기 손으로 죽이지 않을 뿐이죠

translation.en: [Mouw] He lived in a big house on Staten Island.
Our goal was to put a microphone there.
translation.ko: 우리 목표는 그 집을 도청하는 거였어요

translation.en: Then when you play the tapes at trial, your best witnesses are
translation.ko: 도청한 녹음을 재판에서 틀면 최고의 증인들은

translation.en: the criminals themselves, the mobsters.
[Kossler] The problem was you cannot bug anyone without a court order.
translation.ko: 문제는 법원 명령 없이는 누구도 도청할 수 없다는 거였죠

translation.en: I have got to come up with enough information,
either from surveillance or from informants,
that links Paul Castellano to criminal activity.
So the plan was to work our way up from the bottom.
translation.ko: 그래서 우린 밑에서부터 치고 올라갈 계획을 했어요

translation.en: We want the gossip in the family. We want the blabbermouth,
translation.ko: 패밀리 내부의 소문을 알려면 말이 많고

translation.en: the guy who talks a lot.
[woman] When I started as an organized crime investigator,
I was assigned to the Gambino squad.
We were focused on this small group in Queens.
translation.ko: 우린 퀸스에 있는 작은 조직에 집중했어요

translation.en: Bergin Hunt and Fish Club was a Mafia social club
translation.ko: 버긴헌트 피시 클럽은 마피아의 사교 클럽으로

translation.en: where they hung out and talked about their crimes.
translation.ko: 모임도 하고 범죄에 관한 얘기도 나누는 곳이었어요

translation.en: John Gotti was the captain of this little den of thieves.
translation.ko: 존 고티는 이 작은 도둑 소굴의 캡틴이었죠

translation.en: This crew were kind of thuggish, and they handled a lot of street rackets:
translation.ko: 조직원들은 길거리 범죄를 많이 저지르는 흉악범들로 "마릴린 루흐트 특별 수사관, FBI"

translation.en: loan sharking primarily, and gambling, and bookie joints.
And they were hijackers.
That was the more violent crimes.
[Alite] Bergin Hunt and Fish Club was our Wall Street.
When guys go to work on Wall Street, they show up to the office,
translation.ko: 월가로 출근하면 높은 분들이 사무실에 나타나듯

translation.en: and we show up to the Bergin Hunt and Fish Club.
And we wait for our boss, our CEO...
John Gotti.
I'm there 24 hours a day, seven days a week,
on call for when that man wanted me.
We're running numbers. We're running drugs. We're running girls.
Anything that's illegal.
[Mouw] I tasked all the agents:
"Let's find out what these guys are doing, who's making all the money,
translation.ko: 조직원들이 뭘 하는지 돈을 벌어들이는 게 누군지

translation.en: and try to look for a weak link."
[Alite] The FBI had an office very close to the Bergin Hunt and Fish Club.
translation.ko: 버긴헌트 피시 클럽 가까이에 FBI 사무실이 있었어요

translation.en: We were taught, especially by Gotti:
"If they're around, they're around. We know they're around,
so, 'Hello, how are you?' Be cordial." That's about it.
[Mouw] We developed several high-level informants in Gotti's crew
translation.ko: 여러 방법을 동원해서 고티의 조직원 중에 고급 정보원들을 포섭했어요

translation.en: through a variety of means. Some were arrested, some we paid a lot.
translation.ko: 고티의 조직원 중에 고급 정보원들을 포섭했어요 체포하거나 돈으로 매수했죠

translation.en: These guys provided a lot of information
translation.ko: 이 정보원들한테서 약한 고리가 누군지 많은 정보를 얻어냈죠

translation.en: about who the weak links were in that crew.
translation.ko: 약한 고리가 누군지 많은 정보를 얻어냈죠

translation.en: [Alite] John's personal pit bull bodyguard was a tough guy known to be very violent.
translation.ko: 존의 경호원은 매우 폭력적이라고 알려진 거친 남자였어요

translation.en: He would do anything, from making him tons of money
translation.ko: 존의 돈벌이를 위한 일부터 사람을 죽이거나

translation.en: to killing for him, to protecting him.
His name was Angelo Ruggiero.
[Mouw] Informants told us that he was a big gossip.
They called him "Quack Quack." Not to his face.
He ate a great deal. And he talked a great deal.
translation.ko: 아는 것도 많고 말도 많은 사람이어서

translation.en: [chuckles] So... his mouth was always in motion.
Angelo was our blabbermouth.
[Kossler] This was great.
We went to the Attorney General of the United States and got approval
translation.ko: 우린 법무부 장관에게 안젤로 루지에로의 집의

translation.en: to put a bug in Angelo Ruggiero's house.
We were off and running.
[man] A "black bag man" was an agent who had a skill set
for planting a concealed microphone
translation.ko: 잠겨 있는 문을 따고 잠입할 수 있는

translation.en: or getting through a locked door.
And that's basically what was in the black bag of tricks.
translation.ko: 기본적으로 검은 가방 안에 뭐가 들었냐에 따라 달라지죠

translation.en: Many people don't operate in a covert world effectively.
translation.ko: 은밀한 세계에서 효과적으로 작업하는 사람은 많지 않아요

translation.en: They don't blend.
The most successful agents fit sort of my profile.
translation.ko: 제 프로필은 성공한 요원들의 특성과 잘 맞아요

translation.en: Maybe I was a bad kid growing up.
translation.ko: 저는 자라면서 나쁜 아이였던 거 같아요

translation.en: Maybe I learned how to hide and learned how to blend and so on and so forth.
translation.ko: 어떻게 숨고 융합하는지 등을 배웠겠죠 "조 칸타메사 특수 작전팀, FBI"

translation.en: My blending technique would depend on the neighborhood.
translation.ko: 저의 융합 기술은 동네에 따라 달라지는데

translation.en: And generally speaking, I'm just a local guy doing his job.
translation.ko: 대략적으로 지금의 저는 자기 일을 하는 동네 남자예요

translation.en: In the Ruggiero case, the house was always occupied.
translation.ko: 루지에로의 경우 그의 집에는 늘 누군가 있었고

translation.en: The neighborhood was too close and there was never an opportunity
translation.ko: 이웃이 너무 가까이 있어서 잠입할 기회가 전혀 없었죠

translation.en: that we could guarantee the security of the entry team.
So we came up with alternative options.
Ruggiero's residence had problematic wiring.
His telephone service would be out from time to time.
We were just going to see
if we could stretch that into an opportunity to get in the house.
translation.ko: 집 안에 들어갈 수 있을지 확인하기로 했어요

translation.en: The complaint goes in because he has absolute legitimate trouble on his phone.
translation.ko: 전화 통화에 문제가 생기니 불만이 접수됐어요

translation.en: We would ask the phone company to not dispatch... and I would show up.
translation.ko: 우린 통신회사에 직원을 파견하지 말라고 요청하고 대신 제가 찾아갔죠

translation.en: [Cantamessa] Ruggiero's a little hostile.
We were always concerned
that they didn't trust my undercover identity.
translation.ko: 상대가 제 위장 신분을 믿지 않는 거죠

translation.en: But failure...
honestly was not an option.
I'm winging it. I'm making this up as I'm going along,
trying to read the pulse of who I'm dealing with.
Now I had an opportunity.
We ran the wire to the back,
and we're out of there.
[Lucht] I was assigned to listen in on Angelo Ruggiero's home.
When you were assigned a shift, you listened live.
translation.ko: 근무 교대를 받으면 실시간으로 도청 내용을 들어요

translation.en: And you would listen to see who his colleagues are
and who he's in charge of and who he reports to.
He tried to be a little cryptic.
So you were kind of trying to capture the gist of what was being talked about.
translation.ko: 그래서 뭐에 관한 대화인지 요점을 파악하려고 노력해야 해요

translation.en: [Lucht] It was a total immersion into the life of a Mafia household.
So, I never heard so many creative uses of the f-word in my life.
translation.ko: 살면서 처음 듣는 창의적인 욕설들이 들려왔어요

translation.en: [Lucht] If there were some hot, pertinent conversations,
then those things were immediately turned over to the steno pool...
who did their best to transcribe them.
It was like some kind of soap opera.
I got this impression that Angelo was this kind of cranky, over-verbal guy
translation.ko: 안젤로는 자식들을 사랑했던 괴팍하고 말이 많은

translation.en: who loved his kids.
The kids were, um... shall we say, a handful.
He ran around and did a lot of meat-handed management
translation.ko: 그는 바쁘게 움직이며 강압적인 관리를 이어나갔죠

translation.en: of all these crew members in his Mafia crew and his family.
[Lucht] It was harder to understand certain sections.
So all the agents tended to get assigned to reviewing these conversations
translation.ko: 그런 건 대화 내용을 분별력 있는 녹취록으로 옮길 수 있도록

translation.en: in order to make the transcripts sensible.
translation.ko: 모든 요원이 투입돼서 다시 검토하곤 했어요

translation.en: And so you listened again and again and again.
You were kind of trying to put the puzzle together.
I mean, it was a real slow-going art.
People on the squad had different input, and they'd say, "Wait, I hear this,"
translation.ko: 팀원들 의견이 다르면 '잠깐, 난 이렇게 들려'

translation.en: and then you'd say, "Yeah, that's the key.
That's what's going on in here."
He would make reference to it.
Did he get it? You know, did he get it?
We're sitting there like, "Well, what is he talking about, you know?"
You know, but then you had to put it with who he's speaking to.
translation.ko: 게다가 대화 상대가 누군지도 기재해야 했어요

translation.en: Who was that at the other end of that telephone?
[Lucht] And of course, the FBI had technical abilities
translation.ko: 물론 FBI는 전화를 추적하는 기술이 있었고

translation.en: to track the phone, and over time, you'd figure out who it is.
translation.ko: 시간이 지나면 누구인지 알아낼 수 있었어요

translation.en: And then when you put it together, you'd say, he said, "Did you get it?"
translation.ko: 그걸 조합하면 이런 말이 돼요 '그거 받았어?'

translation.en: And he's talking to a guy who is a big drug dealer.
Here we are in the middle of the day.
Angelo is talking about two- or three-kilo heroin deals,
translation.ko: 안젤로가 2, 3kg 정도의 헤로인 거래 얘기를 하는데

translation.en: while his wife and daughter are a few feet away washing the dishes.
translation.ko: 조금 떨어진 곳에서 아내와 딸이 설거지를 했어요

translation.en: [Lucht] We had gathered evidence
translation.ko: 우린 안젤로가 수백만 달러의 헤로인을 거래하는

translation.en: that Angelo was a big-time, multimillion-dollar heroin dealer.
translation.ko: 우린 안젤로가 수백만 달러의 헤로인을 거래하는 거물이라는 증거를 수집했어요

translation.en: It was a big deal.
But we still didn't have enough evidence that links Ruggiero's criminal activity
translation.ko: 하지만 루지에로의 범죄행위를 감비노 패밀리의 보스인

translation.en: to Paul Castellano, the boss of the Gambino family.
translation.ko: 폴 카스텔라노와 연결할 증거는 충분하지 않았죠

translation.en: [Mouw] For almost 6 months, we followed him around
so we knew where he went for different meetings.
translation.ko: 또 다른 회의를 위해 가는 곳을 찾았어요

translation.en: We came to find out that he'd go up to the boss of the family,
translation.ko: 그가 패밀리의 보스인 폴 카스텔라노의 집을

translation.en: Paul Castellano's house on a regular basis.
And then when the meeting was over, Ruggiero would come back to his house.
translation.ko: 회의가 끝나면 루지에로는 자신의 집으로 돌아가서

translation.en: And other Mob guys would come over,
and Ruggiero would tell them all about what happened at the meeting.
translation.ko: 회의에서 있었던 일을 다 얘기해 주는 거예요

translation.en: It's a big deal to meet with the boss of the family.
It's a dream come true.
It's proof that Castellano was meeting members of his crew at his house
translation.ko: 카스텔라노가 자신의 집에서 조직원들과 범죄에 관한 얘기를 한다는 증거니까요

translation.en: and talking criminal matters.
This was the proof we wanted for approval for electronic surveillance
translation.ko: 이건 카스텔라노 집의 전자 감시 승인을 받는데

translation.en: of Castellano's house.
[Kossler] It was an unbelievable moment,
because now we could finally bug the boss's house.
translation.ko: 이제 보스의 집을 도청할 수 있게 됐으니까요

translation.en: But it was gonna be a very tricky operation.
[Cantamessa] It was a big house. It was referred to as the White House.
The surveillance squad, after many, many hours of surveillance,
translation.ko: 감시팀이 오랜 시간에 걸쳐 집을 감시한 끝에

translation.en: had come to the determination
it's impossible to get in there surreptitiously
because the house was never empty.
translation.ko: 그 집은 절대 비는 일이 없었거든요

translation.en: Castellano had lots of new things in the house.
He had the latest telephone equipment,
and he had cable TV,
specifically a CNN channel, which was new at the time.
translation.ko: CNN 채널이 나오는 케이블 TV도 있었어요

translation.en: [announcer] Get in touch with the world. Touch it. Get in touch with the news.
Touch it.
Get in touch when you want, 24 hours a day. CNN headline news.
[Cantamessa] We learned all of his meetings and conversations
took place in his kitchen, dinning room area.
translation.ko: 부엌의 다이닝룸 구역에서 이뤄진다는 걸 알았는데

translation.en: That was where the TV was and that looked like a real opportunity.
translation.ko: 그곳에 TV가 있다는 것이 진정한 기회로 보였어요

translation.en: So we started doing a little homework on cable TV.
translation.ko: 그래서 케이블 TV에 관해 공부하기 시작했죠

translation.en: It's daybreak in the east.
It's the 17th of May, good morning.
[Cantamessa] I learned it's very easy to introduce interference in cable systems.
translation.ko: 저는 케이블 시스템에 방해 전파를 보내는 게 쉽다는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: [Cantamessa] So, we introduced a problem into the house...
translation.ko: 그래서 그 집에 방해 전파를 보냈어요

translation.en: annoying and aggravating enough
that if somebody showed up to troubleshoot a problem,
translation.ko: 짜증 나고 약 오르게 해서 누군가 그 문제를 해결해 주러 오면

translation.en: they'd be happy to see them.
I'm the cableman now.
[Cantamessa] I ring the doorbell.
Lots of chimes, as I recall.
The gentleman that answers the door happens to be Tommy Bilotti,
Paul's right-hand guy.
The guy was a killer.
If something goes wrong, I need to get out of here immediately.
translation.ko: 일이 잘못되면 당장 탈출해야 할 상황이었어요

translation.en: [Cantamessa] I'm calling into the office, and they're going to test the line.
translation.ko: 저는 사무실에 전화해서 회선을 테스트하라고 했어요

translation.en: I'm actually calling Art, who is my other agent out there.
translation.ko: 사실 밖에 있는 동료 요원 아트에게 전화한 거였죠

translation.en: And when I go, "Art, I'm tapping on this."
As I'm tapping, he's making interference.
translation.ko: 그럼 두드리는 동안 아트는 방해 전파를 보내서

translation.en: TV's blinking.
[Cantamessa] Preplanned, all orchestrated, bench tested before I went.
translation.ko: 모두 들어가기 전에 계획과 실행 테스트까지 끝낸 작전이었어요

translation.en: Including my level of uncooperativeness.
I'm acting like we have to come back.
translation.ko: 저는 다시 와야 할 것처럼 굴며

translation.en: You have to make an appointment.
They don't like appointments.
So, no appointment.
We're gonna do this. We're gonna do this right now.
I took a risk.
I said, "If you give me a hand for just a minute,
I promise I'll be out of here."
"What do you need?"
I go, "Would you just come over here and hold the flashlight for me?"
translation.ko: 이쪽으로 와서 손전등 좀 비춰달라고 했죠

translation.en: So Tommy Bilotti helped me while I installed the device
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 도청기가 숨겨진 장비를 설치하는 동안

translation.en: that had the microphone in it.
Microphone was active.
They were glad to not have me be there too long, and I was glad to leave.
translation.ko: 그들은 제가 금방 가서 좋아했고 저는 나올 수 있어서 좋았죠

translation.en: You know what it takes to stop a crime? Your help and your neighbors'.
translation.ko: 범죄 예방에 필요한 게 뭘까요? 여러분과 이웃의 도움입니다

translation.en: Take a bite out of crime. [chomps]
Everybody was just thrilled with the successful installation
translation.ko: 폴 카스텔라노의 집에 도청기가 성공적으로 설치되자

translation.en: of the wire in Paul Castellano's house. I mean, that was just-- Wow.
translation.ko: 모두 흥분을 감추지 못했어요 정말 대단한 일이었죠

translation.en: Your expectations are great. You expect to hear about murder.
translation.ko: 기대감이 컸어요 살인에 관한 얘기를 듣게 되길 기대했죠

translation.en: Kill this guy and kill that guy. It was a big day for the FBI.
translation.ko: 살인에 관한 얘기를 듣게 되길 기대했죠 FBI에겐 대단한 날이었어요

translation.en: [Kossler] Paul Castellano, the boss of the Gambino family, was on tape.
translation.ko: 감비노 패밀리의 보스인 폴 카스텔라노의 목소리가 들렸죠

translation.en: This was really significant,
in that he was the boss of one of the largest families in the Mafia.
translation.ko: 그는 가장 큰 마피아 패밀리 중 하나의 보스였으니까요

translation.en: People wouldn't even dream about this ten years before.
The sound of a Mafia kitchen, you know what it is?
translation.ko: 마피아의 주방에서 어떤 소리가 나는지 아세요?

translation.en: It's eggs being beaten in a bowl.
I don't recall listening to any meetings with others.
translation.ko: 다른 사람들과 회의하는 건 기억이 안 나는 데

translation.en: I just remember Castellano and Gloria talking.
Gloria was the maid in this giant mansion that they had.
She cleaned and cooked, and she'd been there for quite a while.
I got this impression.
She had a certain amount of personality and they clicked.
translation.ko: 어느 정도 개성이 강한 여자고 그들은 그걸 좋아했다

translation.en: You'd listen to this and you'd go, "What is that?
Alright, stop it here and back it up." And the reels would go around.
translation.ko: '여기서 멈추고 다시 돌려봐' 테이프가 다시 돌아가죠

translation.en: "Let's play it again."
"Oh, God no! Oh, my God!"
Everybody's suddenly realized
he was having a torrid affair with his maid.
translation.ko: 폴은 그 가정부와 불륜 관계였다는 걸요

translation.en: Poor Joe O'Brien had to be all tuned in to that little soap opera.
translation.ko: 가엾은 조 오브라이언도 이 드라마에 채널을 맞춰야 했어요

translation.en: [man] My job was to make a prosecutable case against Paul Castellano.
translation.ko: 제 임무는 폴 카스텔라노를 기소할 사건을 수사하는 거였어요

translation.en: I had people talking to me that didn't even know they were informants,
translation.ko: 본인도 모르게 제 정보원이 된 사람들이 있었어요

translation.en: including Paul Castellano's maid and lover, Gloria Olarte.
translation.ko: 폴 카스텔라노와 가정부이자 연인인 글로리아도 포함되죠

translation.en: She would we take pictures,
family pictures and pictures of Castellano meeting his associates.
translation.ko: 가족사진과 카스텔라노가 준조직원들과 만나는 것도 찍고

translation.en: She gave me those photographs.
But she was an unwitting source.
She didn't know about the bug in Castellano's house.
translation.ko: 하지만 자기가 정보원인 걸 몰랐고 카스텔라노의 집을 도청하는 것도 몰랐어요

translation.en: [O'Brien] You listen to 600 hours' worth of tapes, you get to know the guy.
translation.ko: 600시간 분량의 녹음을 들으면 그 사람을 잘 알게 돼요

translation.en: So... I did something a little unusual.
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 좀 특이한 짓을 했어요

translation.en: I started sending him greeting cards.
Birthday cards.
Get well cards. I heard he was sick.
translation.ko: 아플 때는 쾌유하라는 카드도 보냈어요 "당신이 병원에 있는 동안 당신을 생각해요"

translation.en: I sent him a card: "To a special godfather."
I was messing with him. This was psychological warfare.
I wanted to see what they were made of.
My partner Andy and I were listening and had the headsets on.
He talked about the greeting cards.
A lot of profanity and everything. Kind of funny when you listen to the guy
translation.ko: 욕설을 퍼부어댔죠 카드를 보고 제 얘기하는 걸 들으니 좀 우습더군요

translation.en: and he's opening a card and talking about you.
translation.ko: 카드를 보고 제 얘기하는 걸 들으니 좀 우습더군요

translation.en: That's when Gloria revealed that she'd been meeting with me privately.
translation.ko: 그때 글로리아가 저와 개인적으로 만나왔다고 밝혔어요

translation.en: And I figured, "Uh-oh."
He scolded her like a little schoolgirl.
"You don't meet with Mr. Joe anymore.
You stay away from O'Brien. You understand, Gloria."
Castellano's bodyguard started goading him.
"We can get rid of this guy, O'Brien."
They were goading Castellano to put a contract out on my life.
Scary people, you know. They're murders. They're psychopaths.
It was said that Castellano could order somebody killed
translation.ko: 카스텔라노는 눈썹만 까딱해도 살해 명령을 내릴 수 있는 거예요

translation.en: by just lifting an eyebrow. Didn't have to say a word.
translation.ko: 카스텔라노는 눈썹만 까딱해도 살해 명령을 내릴 수 있는 거예요 말도 필요 없는 거죠

translation.en: If he had gone silent, it would have been all over for me.
translation.ko: 그가 아무 말 안 했다면 저는 끝장인 거죠

translation.en: But Castellano said, "No.
Bring too much heat on the family.
Just be careful, you know. He's just doing his job."
translation.ko: '조심해, 조는 그냥 자기 일을 하는 거야'

translation.en: He defended me, so I gotta give credit for that.
translation.ko: 제 편을 들어줬어요 그건 저도 고마워해야죠

translation.en: But it didn't change the fact that the whole object of my case
translation.ko: 하지만 제 수사의 목적이 카스텔라노를 평생 연방 교도소에

translation.en: was to put Castellano in a federal prison for life.
I started getting evidence to implicate him.
translation.ko: 저는 그가 연루된 증거를 찾기 시작했어요

translation.en: Castellano talked about all kinds of things.
He talked with Tommy Gambino about dividing up the Garment District.
translation.ko: 그는 토미 감비노와 가먼트 지구 분할을 논의했고 "토머스 감비노"

translation.en: He spoke with Joe N. Gallo about all the various rackets they were involved in.
translation.ko: 조 N. 갈로와는 그들이 연루된 모든 범법행위에 관해 얘기했고

translation.en: He spoke with Joe Armone about the restaurant union.
translation.ko: 조 아르모네와는 식당 노조에 관해 얘기했어요

translation.en: [Kossler] We were hearing more and more
about their involvement with the labor unions.
That was important information because it showed the real problem
translation.ko: 중요한 정보였어요 그건 조직범죄의 진정한 문제점을 나타내기 때문이죠

translation.en: of organized crime...
translation.ko: 그건 조직범죄의 진정한 문제점을 나타내기 때문이죠

translation.en: that the organized crime groups controlled the major labor unions in this country.
translation.ko: 조직범죄 집단은 이 나라의 주요 노조를 장악했던 거예요

translation.en: We were hearing how the Mafia controlled the Teamsters trucking union,
translation.ko: 팀스터스 운송 노조를 마피아가 어떻게 장악했는지

translation.en: the Laborers' Union,
the longshoremen union,
the hotel employees' union.
There's so many ways they used the unions to make money.
translation.ko: 그들은 돈벌이를 위해 노조를 여러 방면으로 이용했어요

translation.en: They could extort companies to give their friends jobs.
translation.ko: 친구들의 일자리를 위해 회사들을 갈취할 수도 있었고

translation.en: They could give him health benefits.
[Franzese] The Mob had a lot of power,
because we controlled the unions.
We call in a strike with the Teamsters,
two and a half million people stop working.
That's a lot of power.
Not to mention the pension funds that you had at your disposal.
translation.ko: 마음대로 쓸 수 있는 연금 기금은 말할 것도 없죠

translation.en: You got hundreds of millions of dollars sitting in the bank
translation.ko: 은행에 잠자고 있는 수억 달러의 돈은

translation.en: that you can move anywhere you want. You control bankers that way.
translation.ko: 어디든 송금할 수 있었어요 그런 식으로 은행가들을 조종하고

translation.en: You control insurance companies that way. And we used that.
-[tape rewinding] -[man] And he gave me $5,000.
You control the unions. You control the Teamsters. You control the docks.
You control the country.
